Dear Timothy Nelson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Employment policies and procedures; establishment
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107
Section (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
Description and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is a concern that there was an inappropriate relationship
between a youth and a staff member when the youth resided at
the facility. The staff member has been witnessed visiting the
youth at their home since the youth's discharge on 10/14/24.
They were observed sitting in a vehicle and smoking vapes.
There are also concerns that sexual contact may have taken
place.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was attempted to be interviewed via phone on
December 13, 2024, and voicemail was left. An email was also
sent to Staff 1’s most recent personal email address. On
December 19, 2024, another attempt was made to interview Staff
1 via phone but her phone number is stating the phone has been
shut off. On December 23, 2024, face-to-face interview was
attempted at Staff 1’s last known address, in collaboration with
Law Enforcement and MDHHS Worker but no one answered the
door.
Mother 1 was interviewed face to face at her home and at the
facility on October 28, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker and Law Enforcement. Mother 1 reported Youth A
returned home from the facility on October 14, 2024. She reported
he is currently on house arrest and is monitored by a tether.
Mother 1 reported on Wednesday or Thursday of last week, Youth
A ran out of the house, and she was asking him where he was
going because he was on house arrest. She reported she
witnessed Youth A go into a dark blue compact car where a white
female with blonde hair was in the driver’s seat. Youth A came
back into the home and had a cell phone with him. Mother 1
reported Youth A does not have a cell phone. She reported she
asked Youth A who was in the car, he told her it was a woman
from the facility. Mother 1 reported Youth A began to brag about
how this woman liked him and let him use her vape when he was
in the facility. She reported Youth A’s actual girlfriend (unable to
3

obtain name) said this woman was also talking to her on
Facebook and identified her as Staff 1. She was unable to show
any documentation of this occurring to show that this was Staff 1’s
information. Mother 1 reported Youth A would not disclose much
more. She reported she is unaware if she has come to her house
more than once or the timeframe of when he was allowed to use
her vape while at the facility. Mother 1 reported she was made
aware by Youth A that there was already an incident with Staff 1
when he was placed at the facility. She explained Youth A
discussed how a youth at the facility wrote a complaint about Staff
1 being to close with the youth at the facility but denied any
concerning inappropriate boundaries.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at school on November
6, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
Staff 1 visited him at his home after he was discharged from the
facility. He denied that she provided him with a phone and stated
that he had gotten his phone on his own. Youth A reported Staff 1
came to see him at his home to make sure he was doing alright
and making positive choices. He reported Staff 1 is more like a
mentor. Youth A reported he talked to Staff 1 via text message
after he was discharged and that is how she knew when to come
meet him. He would not disclose how he got her phone number
and reported the last time he spoke to her was when she came to
his home. Youth A denied Staff 1 having poor boundaries with him
in the facility or post-discharge. He reported Staff 1 has never
been inappropriate with him and that she is just a mentor. Youth A
denied ever getting vapes from Staff 1 or any staff at the facility.
He reported he is aware a youth at the facility filed a grievance
against Staff 1 for showing favoritism towards him. Youth A
reported that was not true and Staff 1 just is a caring person, not
inappropriate. He reported he knows the staff are not allowed to
see youth post-discharge as the youth were told this at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement.
Youth B reported he filed a complaint about Staff 1 because she
was the one to put him in a more restricted pod for finding a
weapon on him. He reported he felt that if she was going to get
him in trouble, he would get her into trouble. Youth B reported he
resided in the unit with Youth A and would see Youth A flirt with
Staff 1. He reported Staff 1 and Youth A would intertwine their feet
under the table. Youth B reported Staff 1 would talk about her
personal life and talked about her relationship with her boyfriend.
He reported Staff 1 also talked to the youth about how another
staff at the facility wanted to have sex with her. Youth B reported
4

that he heard from Youth D that Staff 1 would pass letters to
Youth C about how Youth C could live with her post his discharge.
He reported staff are not allowed to write notes to youth. Youth B
reported staff are supposed to maintain professional boundaries
and act like teachers to the youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face via Microsoft TEAMS at
his current facility on December 9, 2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he was placed in the facility
first time from March 2024 to May 9, 2024. He then came back to
the facility on July 15, 2024, to November 2024. Youth C reported
he met Staff 1 when he was first placed there and there was
nothing inappropriate. He reported when he came back in July
2024, Staff 1 would flirt with him. He reported she wrote him
letters and told him to then flush them down the toilet, which he
complied with. Youth C reported he does not remember exactly
what the letters stated but remembered them being like love
letters and saying he could live with her when he gets out of
placement. He reported he never told staff about these letters
happening but did tell Mother 2 about these letters. Youth C
reported when Mother 2 found out, she told the facility Staff 1 was
writing Youth C letters. He reported once Mother 2 told the facility,
Staff 1 distanced herself from him for a couple of weeks before he
discharged from the facility. When asked if there was anything
else that happened with Staff 1, he reported that there was, and
he did not disclose this to Mother 2. Youth C reported Staff 1
would take him to the janitor’s closet when everyone was sleeping
on the pod and in the closet, she sucked his “dick” with her mouth.
He reported this happened once or twice but does not remember
the exact date when it occurred. Youth C reported he also had sex
with Staff 1 in the janitor's closet at night. He disclosed he did put
his penis in her vagina. Youth C reported this only occurred once
and does not remember when exactly. He reported he does know
that this occurred when he was placed there between July 2024 to
November 2024. Youth C reported he never disclosed this
information to anyone at the facility and no one ever saw him
because it was when everyone was sleeping. He reported that he
followed through with these sexual acts because he did not want
to make Staff 1 mad or get in trouble.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement.
Youth D reported he was in a pod with Youth C. He denied any
concerns about Staff 1. Youth D reported he never saw Staff 1
have inappropriate boundaries with the youth. He reported there
5

were rumors going on that Staff 1 was writing inappropriate notes,
but he never saw the letters.
Youth E was interviewed face to face via Microsoft TEAMS at
his current facility on December 9, 2024. Youth E reported he
had no concerns when residing at the facility and felt safe there.
He denied seeing any staff have inappropriate boundaries with
youth. He reported that Youth B did write a complaint about Staff 1
having inappropriate boundaries with other youth because Staff 1
had given him a consequence. Youth E reported he never saw or
heard about Staff 1 being inappropriate or writing notes to youth at
the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Staff 2 reported she overheard Youth B and
Youth E talking about Staff 1 and that she would get fired one day
for her actions. She reported Youth E commented on how
Children’s Protective Services will get involved and he does not
want to be part of that. Staff 2 reported she talked to both youth
about the comments they were making and both reported that
Staff 1 had inappropriate boundaries with Youth A. She reported
Youth B explained Staff 1 would sit close to Youth A and share
about her personal relationship struggles with the youth. Staff 2
reported Youth B heard she was passing notes to Youth C about
letting him live with her post-discharge. She reported she told
these concerns to Supervisor right away. Staff 2 reported staff
need to maintain professional boundaries with the youth and not
talk about their personal life. She reported staff are not to visit with
the youth post their discharge from the facility. Staff 2 reported
she did not work much with Staff 1 and stated she did not hear or
see her have any poor boundaries with the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Supervisor reported Staff 2 reported the
concerns Youth B disclosed about Staff 1 passing notes to Youth
C and inappropriate boundaries with Youth A. He reported he
informed Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 of these concerns
immediately. Supervisor reported he searched Youth C’s room
and personal items but did not find any letters. He reported Mother
2 reported concerns to him after visitation that Staff 1 was being
too “flirty” with Youth C during her visitation on October 23, 2024.
Supervisor reported he reported this concern to Administrator 1
and Administrator 2. He reported he was the direct supervisor of
Staff 1 and never witnessed her have any boundary concerns with
6

the youth on the unit. Supervisor reported Staff 1 had to be trained
to make sure there was always appropriate space between herself
and the youth. He reported staff are trained to always maintain
professional boundaries with the youth and not talk about their
personal life. Supervisor reported staff are not allowed to write
notes to the youth. He reported staff are also trained that they are
not allowed to contact a youth post their discharge.
Mother 2 was interviewed via phone on November 12, 2024.
Mother 2 reported Youth C disclosed to her, Staff 1 would provide
Youth C inappropriate books and include personal letters inside
the books. She reported Youth C stated these letters talked about
Staff 1 wanting Youth C to come live with him and them being in a
relationship. Youth C told Mother 2 that Staff 1 told him to flush
the letters down the toilet. Mother 2 reported she saw Staff 1
flirting with Youth C during their visits. She reported Staff 1 would
put her hand on his shoulder and wink at him.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed
together at the facility on October 28, 2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement. Administrator 2
reported he was made aware of the concerns Mother 1 had from
speaking with Probation Officer 1. Administrator 1 reported he and
Administrator 2 had been doing an internal investigation on a
grievance form they received involving concerns about Staff 1’s
professional boundaries with the youth. It was explained on
October 9, 2024, that Youth B and Youth E reported to Staff 2 that
Staff 1 was behaving inappropriately with Youth A and Youth C. It
was reported Staff 1 was passing inappropriate notes to Youth C,
and then Supervisor completed a room search of Youth C’s room
and found no notes. On October 10, 2024, Administrator 1
received a grievance form from Youth C about the allegations. He
reported an internal investigation was completed where interviews
were completed with Youth A, Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, and
Staff 1 and all denied the inappropriate behavior and notes. Staff 1
admitted she had brought books in for Youth C to help cope with
the loss of his brother. She also admitted to sharing personal and
similar life circumstances with Youth A as a means of support.
Staff 1 admitted to Administrator 1 that Youth C liked her, but it
didn’t concern her, and admitted she did not report his statement
to Supervisor as they are required to do. Administrator 1 and
Administrator 2 reported they told Staff 1 about the rules
prohibiting her from bringing books to residents and warned her
that she should not be sharing personal information with residents.
On October 24, 2024, Mother 2 called Supervisor to report Staff 1
was being flirtatious with her son, Youth C, during visitation on
7

October 23, 2024. Administrator 1 reported he reviewed the
camera footage with Administrator 2 from that visitation and did
not confirm Staff 1 being flirtatious. On October 24, 2024,
Administrator 1 talked with Mother 2 about her concerns, and she
stated that Youth C lied during the interview about the letters and
stated Youth C did disclose to her about the inappropriate letters.
Administrator 1 reported these letters were never physically found.
On October 25, 2024, Administrator 2 received a phone call about
the concerns of these current allegations from Probation Officer 1.
Administrator 1 reported on that same day Staff 1 was suspended
from work pending this investigation. He reported on October 27,
2024, Staff 1 resigned from her position at the facility.
Probation Officer 1 was interviewed via phone on October 28,
2024. Probation Officer 1 reported she is assigned as Youth A’s
probation officer. She reported she was made aware of the
allegations from Mother 1, and she told Administrator 2 about the
concerns. Probation Officer 1 reported she did not have any
concerns about the care Youth A received while he was placed at
the facility.
Probation Officer 2 was interviewed via phone on November
20, 2024. Probation Officer 2 reported she is assigned to Youth
C’s case. She reported Youth C has never disclosed any concerns
of any staff being sexually inappropriate with him while at the
facility. Probation Officer 2 reported Youth C can be flirtatious and
“push the limits” by making woman feel uncomfortable. She
reported when she meets with Youth C, she has another adult in
the room with her, so she is never alone with him in person.
Probation Officer 2 reported she has no concerns with the facility.
MDHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on February 4,
2024. MDHHS Worker reported she completed a follow up
interview with Surveillance Officer as Youth A had disclosed
additional information to her. She reported Surveillance Officer did
make an official report in November 2024 when Youth A made the
disclosure.
Surveillance Officer was interviewed via phone on February
4, 2024. Surveillance Officer reported on November 12, 2024, she
made a report due to concerns of Youth A reporting to her
concerning allegations that occurred with Staff 1. She reported
when Youth A was released from the facility, her job was to do
check-ins in the community with Youth A. Surveillance Officer
reported on November 12, 2024, when she was doing a check in
with Youth A at his home, Staff 1 came to his home after he was
8

released and provided him a cell phone. Youth A reported he
exchanged sexual photos with Staff 1 on that phone. Surveillance
Officer reported Youth A refused to give up the phone and did not
show her any of the photos. She reported Youth A disclosed he
had groped Staff 1 underneath the table at the facility when he
was placed there. He reported he had sexual intercourse with
Staff 1 both inside and outside of the facility. Youth A did not
disclose where in the facility they had sexual intercourse but
reported that when he was released, he met up with her at a hotel.
Surveillance Officer reported Youth A disclosed this hotel meet up
occurred prior to him getting his tether put on. Surveillance Officer
reported Youth A stated he would not disclose any of this
information to Law Enforcement or anyone else because “he is not
a rat” and he wanted to have sexual intercourse with Staff 1.
Surveillance Officer reported Youth A stated Staff 1 had sexual
intercourse with other youth but would not disclose who it was.
She reported she recently heard from Mother 2 who reported
Youth C’s disclosure of having sexual intercourse with Staff 1.
Surveillance Officer reported she has worked with Youth C prior,
and he made false allegations in the past about older adults
having sexual intercourse with him. She reported when she
worked with Youth C, he tried to flirt with her and when she held
him accountable, he made accusations about her trying to “hook
up” with him which was found to be untrue.
Youth A was reinterviewed via phone while MDHHS Worker
was face to face at Youth A’s home on February 5, 2025. This
consultant attempted to interview Youth A face to face with
MDHHS Worker at Youth A’s school on the same day but was
out sick. Youth A reported that he felt safe while at home and
when he was placed at the facility. He denied ever having

phone. Youth A reported he has not talked to Staff 1 since the last
time he spoke with this consultant and MDHHS Worker in
November 2024. He denied Staff 1 ever coaching him to not talk
to us or promising him special items in exchange for a
relationship. Youth A reported Staff 1 was nice, and he felt that
she had a crush on him. When asked to explain, he denied
anything physical ever happened and he just had a feeling she
liked him because she was nice to him.

Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 10/23/2024 in the visitation room was reviewed
on 11/06/2024 with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement. Staff 1
was on the opposite side of the room throughout the visitation
Youth C had with Mother 2. There were no interactions seen
between Staff 1 and Youth C on the video reviewed.
Documents reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 began working at
the facility on February 5, 2024. She had no disciplinary
actions noted in her file prior to this investigation. Staff 1
was complaint with all training regulations including Child
Protection Act/ Client Rights on February 6, 2024, and
PREA LAW / Appropriate Relationships with Residents
training on February 7, 2024. On October 27, 2024, Staff 1
submitted a resignation letter effective immediately and an
explanation was not provided.
- Facility Internal Investigation Notes completed by
Administrator 1- These notes are consistent with the
interview completed with Administrator 1 and Administrator
2 on October 28, 2024.
- Email dated October 9, 2024, from Supervisor to
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2- Supervisor
reported Staff 2 notified him of Youth B and Youth E’s
expressed concerns of inappropriate boundaries and
inappropriate flirtatious or sexual behavior around
residents. It was reported Staff 1 had demonstrated
inappropriate physical boundaries towards Youth A. It was
reported Staff 1 will frequently physically be too close to
Youth A and she made comments to Youth A about him
moving into her home after he is discharged. Youth B and
Youth E also reported Staff 1 was writing letters to Youth C.
Supervisor reported he did a room search of Youth A’s
personals and folder and did not find anything at the time.
- Email dated October 24, 2024, from Supervisor to
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2- Supervisor
reported Mother 2 reported concerns about Staff 1. Mother
2 reported Youth C disclosed to her that Staff 1 has been
delivering Youth C books with love letters in them. She
reported Youth C explained Staff 1 was telling him he could
move in with her after he discharges from the facility.
Mother 2 reported she did not see the letters but did see
Staff 1 make “flirtatious” gestures during her visitation with
Youth C on October 23, 2024.
10

- Youth Grievance Form completed by Youth B- There is
no date noted on the form. Youth B reported he talked to
Staff 2 about his concerns with Staff 1’s boundaries. He
reported his peer, Youth E reported he is aware of Staff 1
writing a letter to Youth C. Youth B reported Youth D
reported seeing the letter from Staff 1 to Youth C where
Staff 1 made the following comments: “When you get out
we will live together” “and “you gone give me your babies.”
- Kent County Juvenile Detention Center Policies and
Procedures: Relationship with Resident- The
relationship established between a staff member and a
resident in the facility should always be a professional
nature. Personal involvement of a non-professional nature
must be avoided both while the youth is in the detention
center and after the resident is released. Staff members are
not permitted to become socially involved with court wards.
Contact with youth outside of the facility must be reported
to the Chief Administrator for their approval.
- Email from Law Enforcement dated January 23, 2025-
Law Enforcement reported she will not be submitting any
charges of sexual abuse concerns with Staff 1 and Youth A
due to no disclosure from Youth A. Law Enforcement
reported she will be submitting charges up to the
prosecutor office due to the sexual abuse concerns of Staff
1 to Youth C depending on MDHHS Findings.
- Facility Internal Investigation Notes completed by
Administrator 1- Administrator 1 provided his notes from
the internal investigation that was completed with the
concerns of Staff 1’s boundaries. These notes have the
same details noted as within Administrator 1 and
Administrator 2 interview on October 28, 2024.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of Staff 1 not following the
internal policy of relationship with resident. It was found within the
internal investigation the facility completed by Administrator 1 and
Administrator 2, Staff 1 admitted to bringing a book to Youth C
and sharing personal and similar lifer circumstances with Youth A
as a mean of support. Within this internal investigation Staff 1 also
admitted to Administrator 1 that Youth C liked her but did not
report this to Supervisor as she is required to do. Staff 1 was
never interviewed to confirm this information, and this is just noted
from the internal investigation at the facility.
As it pertains to the concerns of inappropriate boundaries and
having a relationship with the youth, Youth A admitted to Staff 1
coming to his home post-discharge from the facility. He also
reported that she did have a conversation with him via phone.
11

Youth A denied Staff 1 ever crossing boundaries with him and was
just being a support to him. He denied she ever touched him
inappropriately, had sexual relations with him both in the facility
and outside the facility, and providing him a cell phone.
Surveillance Officer did report Youth A did disclose to her of
having an inappropriate sexual relationship with Staff 1. Mother 1
reported she did see a woman come to her home but could not
confirm who she was, but Youth A did report to her that it was a
person from the facility. Youth C reported having sexual
intercourse with Staff 1 while he was at the facility and that she
would write him notes at the facility. Due to the reported
timeframe, there was no saved video footage to review.
Surveillance Officer and Probation Officer 2 reported concerns of
Youth C attempting to cross boundaries with any female and has
made false allegations of sexual abuse. Staff 1 was unable to be
interviewed throughout this investigation as she resigned at the
start of the investigation, did not return phone calls or emails and
was not home during the unannounced home visit. Other staff
members, administration team, and Supervisor never witnessed
Staff 1 having inappropriate boundaries with the youth at the
facility. Due to the report from Youth C, MDHHS Worker did have
enough evidence to confirm the allegations of sexual abuse of
Staff 1 to Youth C.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
